channel.title: Want to try but: "can't find background image materials/console/startup_loading.vtf"
channel.description:
Note: heres the install manual I used: [url]https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Installation_Manual[/url]
So after "finishing" up with that (so I thought), then searching for 15 minutes about how to launch it without it's own .exe, and since installer was kind enough to not make a shortcut, and was also kind enough to not place in steam library, I found a workaround with path template for a shortcut and now have this on desktop:
BMS.lnk with target: "G:\Steam\SteamApps\common\Source SDK Base 2007\hl2.exe" -game -sourcetest -steam -game "G:\Steam\SteamApps\sourcemods\BMS"
And get only this when I try to launch: [url]https://www.imagebam.com/image/a4ccb8341005639[/url]
Here is the BMS zip I got: [url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/black-mesa/downloads/black-mesa-part-1zip[/url] [url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/black-mesa/downloads/black-mesa-part-2zip[/url]
Yes: *the zip extracted with no errors.
*SDK 2007 files verified with 4 bad and those then updated
*Steam and BMS are on same drive and same steam path
*Ive been to all the best google results for this error (verbatim) and none of them do jack
Been on this case for about 90 minutes and blood pressure is rising.
goin nuts here.

item.title: Want to try but: "can't find background image materials/console/startup_loading.vtf"
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
The reason is because “Black Mesa Source” narrows the issue too far. Black Mesa is a Source mod just like any other (even though it doesn’t seem like it at times), and follows the same rules. “Source mod shortcut” would likely have yielded the proper way to create a shortcut.

Anyway, glad the issue’s sorted out!

item.title: Want to try but: "can't find background image materials/console/startup_loading.vtf"
item.dc:creator: Sinsearach
item.description:
Crypt:

Did you try restarting Steam? That’s standard for Source mods. Restart Steam and it should appear.

Close. Try

G:\Steam\Steam.exe -applaunch 218 -game "G:\Steam\SteamApps\sourcemods\BMS"

whats that? is that the sweet taste of success?
could it be? lets see here…

amazing.
it was entirely the shortcut that was at issue
NOW it appears in steam.
applause

append:
how could this correct manual shortcut not appear in any of google’s top 40 results (or anywhere in those threads or their peripheral links) searching for that exact error message with “black mesa source” for anyone needing to make the shortcut themselves?
I hope this thread can get up there in search rankings for others to access BMS that are having same issue and who might have given up with less effort than I invested in this solution, being that I only did because I know how great half life is and many youngsters/newcommers do not
